name: ESTATE of Thomas MICHELL, an incompetent. Appeal of Thomas MICHELL

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ.
parties: ESTATE of Thomas MICHELL, an incompetent. Appeal of Thomas MICHELL.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
Decree affirmed. Each party to pay own costs.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Frank L. Newburger, III, Philadelphia, for appellant.
James Francis Lawler, Denis James Lawler, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
409 A.2d 856
ESTATE of Thomas MICHELL, an incompetent. Appeal of Thomas MICHELL.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 10, 1979.
Decided Jan. 18, 1980.
Frank L. Newburger, III, Philadelphia, for appellant.
James Francis Lawler, Denis James Lawler, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN and FLAHERTY, JJ.
